newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA - SAVINGS BANK 1Q NET PROFIT FALLS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA - SAVINGS BANK 1Q NET PROFIT FALLS.

text.p: Lithuania's huge state-run Savings Bank said on Tuesday that its net profit in the first three months of this year was 1.731 million litas versus 4.080 million litas for the same period last year.
The bank also said in a statement that its assets in the first three months of this year grew to 1.278 billion litas from 1.150 billion litas.
It also said that its loan portfolio rose to 571.8 million litas from 505 million litas at the start of the year.
Its deposits increased to 1.119 billion litas from 1.032 billion litas in the same period.
The bank's net profit for 1996 was 30 million litas.
The bank, the second largest in the country in terms of assets, is one of Lithuania's three state-run banks.
The government has committed itself to selling the other two but has made no firm plans regarding the future of the Savings Bank.
